parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.param_type: workspace id of the ticket. this attribute is applicable only to accounts with workspaces. the value 0 for workspace_id will return tickets from all workspaces, with only global level fields.

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.param_type: id of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.param_type: id of the group to which the ticket has been assigned

parameters.name: tag
parameters.param_type: tag that has been associated to the tickets

parameters.name: due_by
parameters.param_type: date (yyyy-mm-dd) when the ticket is due to be resolved

parameters.name: fr_due_by
parameters.param_type: date (yyyy-mm-dd) when the first response is due

parameters.name: bypass_mandatory
parameters.description: To bypass mandatory fields check while updating the ticket except for requester_id, source. Any business rules trying to mandate certain fields will also be bypassed. All fields configured as mandatory upon closing or resolving the ticket will be skipped while updating the ticket. This can only be passed by an admin. Example: api/v2/ticket/{ticket_id}?bypass_mandatory=true

endpoints.name: Create a Child Ticket Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs
endpoints.description: Create a Child Ticket Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.param_type: freshservice/freshservice for business teams: id of the workspace that the ticket belongs to. if not provided, the id of the primary workspace will be defaulted. applicable only to accounts with workspaces. freshservice for msps: workspace_id refers to the client’s id. if not provided for an existing contact, the system will default to the contact's associated client id. for a new contact, the client is determined based on the contact's email domain.

parameters.name: requester_id *
parameters.param_type: for existing contacts/requester, the requester_id can be passed instead of requester's email. freshservice/freshservice for business teams: user id of the requester. freshservice for msps: user id of the contact.

parameters.name: email *
parameters.param_type: email address of the requester. if no contact exists with this email address in freshservice, it will be added as a new contact.

parameters.name: phone *
parameters.param_type: phone number of the requester. if no contact exists with this phone number in freshservice, it will be added as a new contact. if the phone number is set and the email address is not, then the name attribute is mandatory.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.param_type: subject of the ticket. the default value is null.

parameters.name: type
parameters.param_type: helps categorize the ticket according to the different kinds of issues your support team deals with. the default value is incident. * as of now, api v2 supports only type ‘incident’

parameters.name: responder_id
parameters.param_type: id of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.param_type: ticket attachments. the total size of these attachments cannot exceed 40 mb.

parameters.name: cc_emails
parameters.param_type: email address added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email.

parameters.name: custom_fields
parameters.param_type: key value pairs containing the names and values of custom fields. read more here.

parameters.name: due_by
parameters.param_type: timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved.

parameters.name: email_config_id
parameters.param_type: id of email config which is used for this ticket. (i.e., support@yourcompany.com/sales@yourcompany.com)

parameters.name: fr_due_by
parameters.param_type: timestamp that denotes when the first response is due

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.param_type: id of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. the default value is the id of the group that is associated with the given email_config_id

parameters.name: source *
parameters.param_type: the channel through which the ticket was created. the default value is 2.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.param_type: tags that have been associated with the ticket

parameters.name: associate_ci
parameters.param_type: search for asset and associate with ticket

endpoints.curl_example: 1curl -v -u api_key:X -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{ "description": "Details about the issue...", "subject": "Support Needed...", "email": "tom@outerspace.com", "priority": 1, "status": 2, "cc_emails": ["ram@freshservice.com","diana@freshservice.com"], "workspace_id": 3 }' -X POST 'https://domain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets/20/create_child_ticket'

endpoints.name: List all Ticket Fields Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs
endpoints.description: List all Ticket Fields Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Freshservice/Freshservice for Business Teams: ID of the workspace that the ticket belongs to. If not provided, the ID of the primary workspace will be defaulted. Applicable only to accounts with workspaces. Freshservice for MSPs: workspace_id refers to the client’s ID. If not provided for an existing contact, the system will default to the contact's associated client ID. For a new contact, the client is determined based on the contact's email domain.

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.description: Date time at which the field was added

parameters.name: updated_at
parameters.description: Date time at which the field was modified

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of the field for display

parameters.name: field_type
parameters.description: Indicates if the field is a checkbox, dropdown, text field

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: True if the field is marked mandatory

parameters.name: required_for_closure
parameters.description: True if the field is marked mandatory while closing the Release item

parameters.name: default_field
parameters.description: True if the field is a default field. False if customm

parameters.name: choices
parameters.description: List of values supported by the field

parameters.name: required_for_agents
parameters.description: Set to true if the field is mandatory for Agents

parameters.name: required_for_customers
parameters.description: Set to true if the field is mandatory in the customer portal

parameters.name: label_for_customers
parameters.description: Display name for the field (as seen in the customer portal)

parameters.name: customers_can_edit
parameters.description: Set to true if the field can be updated by customers

parameters.name: displayed_to_customers
parameters.description: Set to true if the field is displayed in the customer portal

parameters.name: portal_cc
parameters.description: Applicable only for the requester field. Set to true if customer can add additional requesters to a ticket

parameters.name: portal_cc_to
parameters.description: Applicable only if portal_cc is set to true. Value will be all when a customer can add any requester to the CC list and company when a customer can add only company contacts to the CC list

parameters.name: date_only
parameters.description: Applicable only for custom_date field. When ‘Request time information’ is selected, the field date_only returns false and if unchecked, date_only returns true

endpoints.name: Update a Time Entry Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs
endpoints.description: Update a Time Entry Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs

parameters.name: id
parameters.param_type: id of the time entry read-only

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.param_type: workspace id of the time entry(inherited from the ticket). this attribute is applicable only to accounts with workspaces. read-only

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.param_type: time at which this time-entry is created read-only

parameters.name: updated_at
parameters.param_type: time at which this time-entry is updated read-only

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.param_type: the time at which the time-entry is added. if a timer, which is in stopped state, is started again, date_time at which the timer is started again read-only

parameters.name: timer_running
parameters.param_type: cannot update timer_running to the same existing value.

parameters.name: billable
parameters.param_type: can be set to true or false

parameters.name: time_spent
parameters.param_type: the total amount of time spent by the timer in hh::mm format.

parameters.name: executed_at
parameters.param_type: time at which the timer is executed. default value (unless given in request) is the time at which timer is added. should be less than or equal to current date_time.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.param_type: id of the task assigned to the time-entry. task should be valid on the given ticket and should be assigned to the agent_id

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.param_type: the user/agent to whom this time-entry is to be assigned mandatory

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.param_type: time when the time entry ends. supported for freshservice msps only.

parameters.name: work_type
parameters.param_type: category of work for the time entry. supported for freshservice msps only.

endpoints.description: Create a Task Freshservice Freshservice for Business Teams Freshservice for MSPs

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.param_type: freshservice/freshservice for business teams: id of the workspace that the ticket belongs to. if not provided, the id of the primary workspace will be defaulted. applicable only to accounts with workspaces. freshservice for msps: workspace_id refers to the client’s id. if not provided for an existing contact, the system will default to the contact's associated client id. for a new contact, the client is determined based on the contact's email domain.

parameters.name: agent_id
parameters.param_type: id of the agent to whom the task is assigned

parameters.name: notify_before
parameters.param_type: time in seconds before which notification is sent prior to due date

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.param_type: unique id of the group to which the task is assigned

endpoints.curl_example:
1234567curl -v -u api_key:X -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{
  "due_date": "2020-04-03T10:26:13.067Z",
  "notify_before": 0,
  "title": "Supply lightsabers to all the Jedis",
  "description": "We need to re-supply to win the war!",
  "workspace_id": 3
}' -X POST 'https://domain.freshservice.com/api/v2/tickets/1/tasks'
